page.title: 13EDUCATION 4-18 YRS DOWNDERRY
page.content: THE JUNIOR SCHOOL HAS CHILDREN FROM 4 TO 11 YEARS.THE SCHOOL NUMBERS VARY.IN {1961}59 PUPILS,{1975}A HIGH POINT OF 134,DROPPING TO 91 IN OCTOBER 1985.THE CATCHMENT AREA RANGES OUT OF THE VILLAGES TO HESSENFORD,NARKURS AND THE OUTLYING FARMS e.g.Bucklawren. TRANSPORT BY MINIBUS IS PROVIDED. AT 11 YEARS MOST PUPILS ARE TAKEN TO A COMPREHENSIVE AT TORPOINT.A FEW ARE ABLE TO SELECT LISKEARD,LOOE OR PLYMOUTH WHICH ARE BELIEVED TO CONFER CERTAIN ADVANTAGES.AT 16 YEARS,AFTER { {O LEVEL}EXAMINATIONS THE PUPIL WILL NORMALLY ATTEND SALTASH SCHOOL.MANY PUPILS ARE NOW ELECTING TO STUDY {A {LEVELS }AT OTHER VENUES.A SMALL NUMBER THEN ATTEND UNIVERSITY (OR SIMILAR) MANY CHILDREN TRAVEL LONG DISTANCES EVERY SCHOOL DAY THROUGHOUT THEIR SCHOOL LIFE;A TIME CONSUMING CONSEQUENCE OF CLOSING RURAL SCHOOLS
